description: 'Jill, I am your father.' - Nemesis, probably

0.0.1.description: Use the attached apworld and YAML file with your normal Archipelago install to generate a randomized world for Resident Evil 3 Remake.
0.0.1.title: Initial Alpha

0.0.2.description: Fixes the Toy Shop item location to need Lock Pick - Be sure to update the client as well.
0.0.2.title: Quick Logic Fix

0.0.3.description: Just a couple changes to some locations, nothing major
0.0.3.title: Update locations.json mostly

0.0.4.description:
Changes include, but are not limited to:

Location Fixes

????

The next update will have more, promise.

*Hotfixed because dumb dumb
0.0.4.title: The not so major update

0.1.0.description:
Thanks to Fuzzy, RE3R has been updated to match RE2R's latest changes!

This world update fixes a few locations and adds some previously overlooked locations as well.

Be sure to update to the latest client as well, and enjoy!
0.1.0.title: Beta Release

0.1.1.description:
This release is mainly about Carlos' sections being `mostly` randomized, but also fixes a couple of locations and changes a few to be their vanilla item to prevent potential softlock issues if you accidentally miss/skip them during gameplay. 

Note: Be sure to always update your client and apworld together. In a lot of cases, newer apworlds won't work with older clients, and vice versa.
0.1.1.title: Carlos' Come Up

0.1.3.description:
This release adds DeathLink, adds Damage traps, and updates the APWorld to be compatible with changes in Archipelago version 0.5.0.

Other new features in this release:

Extra Downtown/Sewer item options for a smoother first-time experience
Allow Progression Downtown option because you can potentially miss items if you progress the story too far
Allow Progression in Labs option because having progression in one of the 20ish checks in the final fights is mean
Ported `Oops All Grenades` and the `no X` options from RE2R
Carlos' Locker Room Key and Tape Player are now in the `pool` and will hopefully keep the game from feeling like an A <-> B experience
Added Hardcore Mode

Additionally, this release includes a number of bug fixes:

Fixed some logic bugs
Fixed Grenade Launcher having one ammo instead of it's usual 6
No more invincibility bug
Fixed a few item locations that weren't sending properly and added a couple that were missed
0.1.3.title: Deathlink, Traps, and support for AP 0.5.0

0.1.4.description:
Fixes `Starting_Hip_Pouch` since selecting more than 3 in the yaml was a no no, fixes `Allow Progression In Labs` because typo and adds `Oops All Handguns` because I forgot to push it to main prior to the release.

Be sure to update apworld + client as there was also a fix client side for invincibility!

Happy gaming!
0.1.4.title: Quick Fix

0.1.5.description:
Honestly though, rather lacking in the 'update' department.

This mostly just adds in nightmare/inferno difficulties **(good luck on the latter)**

Also changed 'Extra Downtown Items' to 'Early Fire Hose', since I had to place Bolt Cutters back into their vanilla location due to a bug (for now). If set to true, you'll receive fire hose somewhere in sphere 1 if playing a multiworld. Otherwise, it'll be out in the wild like usual (no change if solo seed)

Fixed a couple broken locations as well, thanks for the bug reports :D definitely helps having ya'll run around the game as well since I am bound to miss something after going through it however many times I'm up to now

Be sure to replace the client with the latest release as well, and happy gaming!
0.1.5.title: Rather Mediocre Update

0.1.6.description:
This is mostly just a bugfix update (the invincibility is killing me softly) but it also gives you...

Poptracker support! While you could use the poptracker with prior versions, I found some underlying issues with item placements and corrected them in this release. If you use the poptracker with prior versions, it will likely lie to you about which items you're grabbing. 

Don't get too excited either, the poptracker only works with standard difficulty (it won't track hardcore/nightmare/inferno specific locations and it'll still show items that get removed during playthroughs of those difficulties)

It will likely stay that way until I get a poptracker released for RE2R, feel that is more important in the long run. 

You can find the poptracker here - https://github.com/dontjoome/RE3R_Poptracker/releases

Be sure to update to the latest client, as well. 

Happy Gaming!
0.1.6.title: Poptracker Update

0.2.1.description:
New Smaller release, since dragons 😅 I just don't want people accidentally grabbing mismatched versions since small update to client was made.

**Jill and Carlos no longer receive every item, and properly receive their own respective items.** This means item boxes will no longer be clogged up by the others key items, weaponry, ammo etc anymore.

**New randomized locations due to the above change:**

- Nemesis Cases (Now have the potential to have progression if allow_missable_locations is turned on in the yaml but will otherwise have useful/junk/traps)

- Safes (They are randomized the old way again, and do not automatically mark off the map as it was the simpler solution to randomizing the location again)

- Tactical Grip for the Assault Rifle (No reason to have it static anymore)

**Some cutscene items are now in the pool proper:**

- Lock Pick
- Override Key
- Culture Sample

**The Shotgun is also now properly in the pool and adds 3 locations** (there were 3 spots where the shotgun could be if you missed it)

**All Breakable Boxes are now in the pool so I hope you remember where they all are.**

**And last but not least, you can now properly chat and send commands in the client window! No longer will you have to open up a separate text client!**

This is a pretty massive update that unfortunately breaks compatibility with the poptracker pack, so use Universal Tracker or !missing commands to follow along with your progress to make sure you haven't missed any item locations.

Be sure to update both apworld and client otherwise there will be dragons.
0.2.1.title: RE3R Ver2

0.2.2.description:
This just changes the Oops All options in a single option to prevent issues if someone trying to combine them, and fixes location issues and changes where some progression can be if allow missable locations was off.

If you didn't play 0.2.1, the juicy notes are over there.
0.2.2.title: RE3R Ver2 Fixes

0.2.3.description:
This mostly just fixes the item rule bug that plagued RE2/3 for a while, and also fixes the Tyrell-FAS location from having the Locker Room Key to prevent softlocks. Also fixes a small issue with the Oops All options where it wasn't grabbing ALL of the items I'd like it to replace. 

Other small changes include the Jewels being just the Jewels, so you no longer have to open up the cases for them.

Also Liquid-Filled Test Tube is now in the pool. 

As always, update both apworld and client, otherwise there will be dragons.
0.2.3.title: Small Bugfix Update

0.2.4.description:
Reverts Liquid-Filled Test Tube back to being static, as it's required for the RTX mod for now. 

This may change again in the future, but I'mma be honest and say that I wasn't happy with being able to skip NEST. 

As always, update your apworld and client together, and happy gaming!
0.2.4.title: RTX Support and Test Tube changes

0.2.5.description:
It’s been a while! This release is mainly focused on bug fixes, but also includes significant reworks to both the client and world.

**All-in-One Client (RTX + Non-RTX)**
You no longer need to download separate clients—both RTX and Non-RTX are bundled into a single, interchangeable download. If you decide to switch versions later, it’s seamless. For now, the repo link will still say “Non-RTX” until the site and other references are updated, but both are the same package.

**Clock Puzzle is Now “Properly” Randomized**
The clock puzzle has been reworked for proper randomization. That said, I still haven’t tracked down the bug where the clock door can “break” in certain cases. As a temporary workaround, a button has been added to the Game Mod window that will manually close the door if needed. A full fix is planned for Version 3 of the randomizer.

**Error Handling Improvements**
Duplicate region issues that caused source errors have been fixed. In addition, the exception handling was adjusted to throw an OptionError if both Oops All options are enabled at the same time.

**PopTracker Pack Overhaul**
The PopTracker pack has been fully updated (currently standard difficulty only). It now includes all new locations and supports the updated hint system—so hinted locations will be visible directly in the tracker. Auto-tabbing and additional difficulties will be added after work on the RE2R tracker pack is finished.

**No More Invincibility Issues!**
A huge thanks to @FuzzyGamesOn for resolving the long-standing invincibility bug, as well as for implementing version matching. This means you no longer need to worry about whether you’re on the latest release or not.

Be sure to download latest client and apworld, and happy gaming!

Side note: You no longer have a "disconnect" function, that prevents you from picking up items if you're not connected like in RE2R, be sure to be properly connected before playing your game.
0.2.5.title: Merged Clients and other goodies!

0.2.6.description:
Almost entirely bugfixes, here's the scoop:

   - Deathlink should now be working properly
   - Fixed not being able to receive items after dying
   - Acid/Flame Rounds were flip-flopped in the client, so you would never receive Flame Rounds (Even from the Supply Case that you get from Nemesis, which I thought was neat and gave me ideas for the future)
   - Updated APworld to be compatible with 0.7.0 (no idea when this is happening)
   - Updated Poptracker to address logic issues
   
***Be sure to update your RE3R APworld, Client and Poptracker Pack***

Thanks to @FuzzyGamesOn as always, and happy gaming!
0.2.6.title: Small Bugfix/Core Change Release
